--- title: "Julia self study" subtitle: "Self studying Julia" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {#eeced7c7 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.julia .cell-code} using DataFrames using CSV using XLSX ``` ::: Make a toy dataframe ::: {#c681d7ab .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function grades_2020() name = ["Sally", "Bob", "Alice", "Hank"] grade_2020 = [1, 5, 8.5, 4] DataFrame(; name, grade_2020) end grades_2020() function grades_2021() name = ["Sally", "Bob", "Alice", "Hank", "John"] grade_2021 = [3, 5, 8.5, 7, 10] DataFrame(; name, grade_2021) end grades_2021() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
5×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2021
StringFloat64
1Sally3.0
2Bob5.0
3Alice8.5
4Hank7.0
5John10.0
``` ::: ::: # Loading and writing files ## CSV files Write the dataframe into CSV file ::: {#d49b0b43 .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.julia .cell-code} CSV.write("toy.csv", grades_2020()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4} ``` "toy.csv" ``` ::: ::: Read in the CSV file ::: {#54fe328e .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.julia .cell-code} toy = CSV.read("toy.csv", DataFrame) first(toy, 5) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=5} ```{=html}
4×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2020
String7Float64
1Sally1.0
2Bob5.0
3Alice8.5
4Hank4.0
``` ::: ::: ## Excel files ::: {#2a075562 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function write_xlsx(name, df::DataFrame) path = "$name.xlsx" data = collect(eachcol(df)) cols = names(df) write(path, data, cols) end function write_grades_xlsx() path = "grades" write_xlsx(path, grades_2020()) "$path.xlsx" end path = write_grades_xlsx() xf = readxlsx(path) ``` ::: # DataFrames.jl ## Filter and subset ::: {#0356f340 .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.julia .cell-code} equals_alice(name::String) = name == "Alice" filter(:name => equals_alice, grades_2020()) filter(:name => n -> n == "Alice", grades_2020()) filter(:name => ==("Alice"), grades_2020()) filter(:name => !=("Alice"), grades_2020()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=6} ```{=html}
3×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2020
StringFloat64
1Sally1.0
2Bob5.0
3Hank4.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#eaf2ff42 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function complex_filter(name, grade)::Bool interesting_name = startswith(name, 'A') || startswith(name, 'B') interesting_grade = 6 < grade interesting_name && interesting_grade end filter([:name, :grade_2020] => complex_filter, grades_2020()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=7} ```{=html}
1×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2020
StringFloat64
1Alice8.5
``` ::: ::: ## Select ::: {#9e95a6b3 .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function responses() id = [1, 2] q1 = [28, 61] q2 = [:us, :fr] q3 = ["F", "B"] q4 = ["B", "C"] q5 = ["A", "E"] DataFrame(; id, q1, q2, q3, q4, q5) end responses() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=8} ```{=html}
2×6 DataFrame
Rowidq1q2q3q4q5
Int64Int64SymbolStringStringString
1128usFBA
2261frBCE
``` ::: ::: ::: {#059b088d .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.julia .cell-code} select(responses(), :id, :q1) # regex select(responses(), r"^q") select(responses(), Not(:q5)) select(responses(), Not([:q4, :q5])) select(responses(), :q5, Not(:q5)) # renaming select(responses(), 1 => "participant", :q1 => "age", :q2 => "nationality") renames = (1 => "participant", :q1 => "age", :q2 => "nationality") select(responses(), renames...) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=9} ```{=html}
2×3 DataFrame
Rowparticipantagenationality
Int64Int64Symbol
1128us
2261fr
``` ::: ::: ## Left and right joins ::: {#7bad1a8c .cell execution_count=10} ``` {.julia .cell-code} leftjoin(grades_2020(), grades_2021(); on=:name) rightjoin(grades_2020(), grades_2021(); on=:name) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=10} ```{=html}
5×3 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2020grade_2021
StringFloat64?Float64
1Sally1.03.0
2Bob5.05.0
3Alice8.58.5
4Hank4.07.0
5Johnmissing10.0
``` ::: ::: ## Transform variables ::: {#80f7385e .cell execution_count=11} ``` {.julia .cell-code} plus_one(grades) = grades .+ 1 transform(grades_2020(), :grade_2020 => plus_one) transform(grades_2020(), :grade_2020 => plus_one => :grade_2020) transform(grades_2020(), :grade_2020 => plus_one; renamecols=false) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=11} ```{=html}
4×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_2020
StringFloat64
1Sally2.0
2Bob6.0
3Alice9.5
4Hank5.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#1a38421d .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.julia .cell-code} leftjoined = leftjoin(grades_2020(), grades_2021(); on=:name) function only_pass() leftjoined = leftjoin(grades_2020(), grades_2021(); on=:name) pass(A, B) = [5.5 < a || 5.5 < b for (a, b) in zip(A, B)] leftjoined = transform(leftjoined, [:grade_2020, :grade_2021] => pass => :pass) passed = subset(leftjoined, :pass; skipmissing=true) return passed.name end only_pass() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12} ``` 2-element Vector{String}: "Alice" "Hank" ``` ::: ::: ## Groupby and combine ::: {#de11382b .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.julia .cell-code} function all_grades() df1 = grades_2020() df1 = select(df1, :name, :grade_2020 => :grade) df2 = grades_2021() df2 = select(df2, :name, :grade_2021 => :grade) rename_bob2(data_col) = replace.(data_col, "Bob 2" => "Bob") df2 = transform(df2, :name => rename_bob2 => :name) return vcat(df1, df2) end all_grades() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=13} ```{=html}
9×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade
StringFloat64
1Sally1.0
2Bob5.0
3Alice8.5
4Hank4.0
5Sally3.0
6Bob5.0
7Alice8.5
8Hank7.0
9John10.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#ea40f78f .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.julia .cell-code} groupby(all_grades(), :name) using Statistics gdf = groupby(all_grades(), :name) combine(gdf, :grade => mean) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ```{=html}
5×2 DataFrame
Rownamegrade_mean
StringFloat64
1Sally2.0
2Bob5.0
3Alice8.5
4Hank5.5
5John10.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#7d0aac75 .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.julia .cell-code} group = [:A, :A, :B, :B] X = 1:4 Y = 5:8 df = DataFrame(; group, X, Y) gdf = groupby(df, :group) combine(gdf, [:X, :Y] .=> mean; renamecols=false) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=15} ```{=html}
2×3 DataFrame
RowgroupXY
SymbolFloat64Float64
1A1.55.5
2B3.57.5
``` ::: ::: ## Missing values ::: {#b50d2782 .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df_missing = DataFrame(; name=[missing, "Sally", "Alice", "Hank"], age=[17, missing, 20, 19], grade_2020=[5.0, 1.0, missing, 4.0], ) dropmissing(df_missing) dropmissing(df_missing, :name) dropmissing(df_missing, [:name, :age]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ```{=html}
2×3 DataFrame
Rownameagegrade_2020
StringInt64Float64?
1Alice20missing
2Hank194.0
``` ::: ::: ::: {#35081e67 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.julia .cell-code} filter(:name => !ismissing, df_missing) combine(df_missing, :grade_2020 => mean ∘ skipmissing ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=17} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: # DataFramesMeta.jl Similar syntax to `dplyr` in `R`. ::: {#23d3449a .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.julia .cell-code} using DataFramesMeta ``` ::: ## Select ::: {#93debed2 .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.julia .cell-code} df = all_grades() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=19} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ## Finale! ::: {#867d6e0f .cell execution_count=34} ``` {.julia .cell-code} @chain leftjoined begin @rtransform begin :grade_2020 = :grade_2020 * 10 :grade_2021 = :grade_2021 * 10 end groupby(:name) @combine begin :mean_grade_2020 = mean(:grade_2020) :mean_grade_2021 = mean(:grade_2021) end @rtransform :mean_grades = (:mean_grade_2020 + :mean_grade_2021) / 2 @rsubset :mean_grades > 50 @orderby -:mean_grades end ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=34} ```{=html}
